sentences: Me seisime ootamas bussi peatuse juures.
context: The word 'seis' is the third person singular form of the Estonian verb 'seisma', which means 'to stand'. It's used when referring to someone or something standing in a particular position. In addition to its literal meaning of physical standing, it can also be used as a command to stop (similar to 'halt!' or 'stop!').
